newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Rato denies deal on health funding - agency.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Rato denies deal on health funding - agency.

text.p: Spanish Economy Minister Rodrigo Rato denied on Thursday a reported deal with the government's Catalan allies to fund regional health spending for around 200 billion pesetas annually, the Europa press agency reported.
"We have not reached a deal," Rato told reporters, although he added that in recent months there have been talks on health system financing.

The financial daily Cinco Dias reported agreement between the government and Convergence and Unity Catalan party, involving a tax hike on alcohol and tobacco, a rise in prescription charges according to income and the removal of tax rebates on health spending.
Furthermore, management of medical checks in cases of temporary incapacity would be passed over to private insurance firms, the report said.
